subject: AI & Agents
title: Learning Without Being Programmed
description: Learn Learning Without Being Programmed in one minute.

hook.text: Nobody programs a spam filter with a list of every spam word. It figures them out by itself.

buildup.text: Traditional software follows explicit rules. Machine learning discovers rules from data.

discovery.text: You give it examples of spam and not-spam. It finds the patterns that distinguish them.

twist.text: The patterns it finds might not be ones you'd ever think of â€” like email header timestamps.

climax.text: This is the core of ML: show enough examples and let the algorithm find the signal.

punchline.text: Don't write the rules. Let the data write them.

quiz.question: How does machine learning differ from traditional programming?
options: It discovers rules from data instead of following explicit instructions
It runs faster than regular programs
